node.title: F.D.A. Approves Second Gene-Altering Treatment for Cancer
node.abstract: The treatment will be for adults with aggressive non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma when chemotherapy has failed. It re-engineers a patient’s own cells to fight cancer.

node.title: Blood and Beauty on a Texas Exotic-Game Ranch

node.title: The F.B.I.’s Black Phantom Menace
node.abstract: A chilling report with echoes of the bureau’s persecution of black activists a half century ago talks of the threat from “black identity extremists.”

node.caption: Demonstrators in Ferguson, Mo., protested the killing by a police officer of Michael Brown in the summer of 2014. A new report by the F.B.I. draws a line from that shooting to a “black identity extremist” threat.
node.copyright: Whitney Curtis for The New York Times

node.title: Californians Will Soon Have Nonbinary as a Gender Option on Birth Certificates
node.abstract: Under a new law, the first in the nation, residents will no longer be limited to identifying themselves as either male or female on state documents.

node.caption: A new California law written by the Democratic state senators Toni Atkins, right, and Scott Wiener, left, offers a third gender option on state-issued identification.
node.copyright: Rich Pedroncelli/Associated Press

node.title: Ebola’s Legacy: Children With Cataracts
node.abstract: Cataracts usually afflict the old, but doctors in Africa have been shocked to find them in Ebola survivors as young as 5.

node.caption: Aminata Conteh, 8, awaiting cataract surgery at a hospital in Freetown, Sierra Leone. Two years after surviving Ebola, Aminata had a cataract, a debilitating complication from the disease that has affected children as young as five.
node.copyright: Jane Hahn for The New York Times

node.caption: Aminata Conteh, 8, awaiting cataract surgery at a hospital in Freetown, Sierra Leone. Two years after surviving Ebola, Aminata had a cataract, a debilitating complication from the disease that has affected children as young as five.

node.title: Picasso Murals Caught Up in Terrorist Attack’s Bitter Legacy
node.abstract: An Oslo building seen as a symbol of social democracy, and damaged in a deadly 2011 car bombing, is to be torn down, with its artworks relocated.

node.caption: Y-Block in Oslo’s government quarter is seen as a symbol of social democracy and bears a mural by Picasso and the Norwegian artist Carl Nesjar. It’s scheduled for demolition, with the mural, “The Fishermen,” due to be moved elsewhere.
node.copyright: Estate of Pablo Picasso/Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York; Kyrre Lien for The New York Times

node.title: Simple Ways to Be Better at Remembering
node.abstract: Memory is a reconstruction, not a photographic recording. Our brains — unlike computers — are forever rerecording those memories.

node.title: Should You Invest Your I.R.A. in Friends, Family or Charitable Work?
node.abstract: Some people are using a special class of I.R.A. — self-directed ones — to invest their nest eggs with a philanthropic twist. But it has its risks.

node.caption: William C. Brown used money from his self-directed I.R.A. to buy a child-care center and rent the property to the owner — the wife of a friend — on a long-term lease, with an option for them to buy it back.
node.copyright: Kathryn Gamble for The New York Times

node.title: Russian Artist Is Charged Over Fire at Central Bank Building in Paris
node.abstract: Pyotr Pavlensky was pictured on social media standing in front of flames at a Banque de France building on the Place de la Bastille.

node.caption: The artist Pyotr Pavlensky in front of a Banque de France building in the Place de la Bastille in Paris. “The Banque de France has taken the place of the Bastille,” he was quoted as saying, “and bankers have taken the place of monarchs.”
node.copyright: Capucine Henry/Associated Press

node.caption: The artist Pyotr Pavlensky in front of a Banque de France building in the Place de la Bastille in Paris. “The Banque de France has taken the place of the Bastille,” he was quoted as saying, “and bankers have taken the place of monarchs.”

node.title: Concussions in Teenagers Tied to Multiple Sclerosis Risk

node.title: When the Revolution Came for Amy Cuddy
node.abstract: As a young social psychologist, she played by the rules and won big: an influential study, a viral TED talk, a prestigious job at Harvard. Then, suddenly, the rules changed.

node.title: Don’t Get Too Comfortable at That Desk
node.abstract: New designs are partly a backlash to wide-open floor plans and include a “palette of places,” meaning that people don’t sit in just one spot.

node.title: Dove Drops an Ad Accused of Racism
node.abstract: In a Facebook ad for Dove body wash, a black woman removes her shirt to reveal a white woman. The company apologized, but similar ads by others have been common.
